intro: Struthanthus elegans, commonly known as the elegant struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Struthanthus elegans is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
